channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Harry Dunn: Lawyers claim phone may have distracted suspect
item.description: The claim appears in court documents for a US hearing into damages for Harry Dunn's fatal crash.

item.title: Chelsea's Ivy Asia restaurant sorry for 'culturally insensitive' advert
item.description: The video features women dressed as geishas being pulled in a rickshaw to the restaurant.

item.title: Same-sex parents battle for inclusive paperwork for baby
item.description: Kate and Gemma Fox have encountered numerous forms they cannot fill in since the birth of their son.

item.title: New 'Banksy' artwork appears at Great Yarmouth model village
item.description: A new model, apparently signed by the artist, is found at a Great Yarmouth attraction.

item.title: Streatham terror attack: Sudesh Amman operation 'an effective result'
item.description: Sudesh Amman was shot dead by surveillance officers after stabbing two people in south London.

item.title: Daughter of 'Robocop' PC becomes Nottinghamshire Police officer
item.description: Rachel Evans says she was inspired to join Nottinghamshire Police after her dad made 309 arrests in a year.

item.title: Peter Kay: Cancer patient 'honoured' to inspire comic's comeback gig
item.description: The comedian returned to the stage to raise money to help pay for student Laura Nuttall's treatment.

item.title: Birmingham riots: Tariq Jahan reflects 10 years on
item.description: Tariq Jahan says he forgives the men who killed his son during the 2011 riots in Birmingham.

item.title: Hampshire murder detective forged statement, court hears
item.description: The officer is accused of forging a witness statement in the Lucy-Anne Rushton murder investigation.

item.title: Downing Street march to save alpaca Geronimo
item.description: More than 90,000 people sign a petition calling on Boris Johnson to halt the alpaca's execution.

item.title: Search continues for missing Lulworth Cove diver off Dorset
item.description: Carvalho da Silveira was last seen in the water on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: UK renewable energy: Major expansion confirmed on Humber
item.description: The government says the Humber region is key to the growth of the UK's offshore wind industry.

item.title: ‘Parkinson’s doesn't stop me playing tennis’
item.description: Andy Wright, who was diagnosed at 33, says his return to the sport helps alleviate symptoms.

item.title: 'Walking to space was the best day of my life'
item.description: Tim, aged nine, walked 62 miles - the distance between Earth's atmosphere and the boundary of space.

item.title: Chorley friendship group made me smile again, says widower
item.description: Gerald says he felt lonely but has "never looked back" since joining a Chorley friendship group.

item.title: How golf helped a Holocaust survivor
item.description: The club was set up for Jewish people to enjoy golf and is about to celebrate its 90th anniversary.

item.title: Covid in Bradford: 'I just want to see mum and dad one last time'
item.description: Young people in Bradford share their intense experiences of the Covid pandemic in an inner city.

item.title: England v India: Joe Root coping well with pressure - Chris Silverwood
item.description: The rest of England's batters must "come to the party" to ease the workload on captain Joe Root, says head coach Chris Silverwood.

item.title: Adam Armstrong: Southampton have bid accepted for Blackburn Rovers striker
item.description: Southampton have a bid accepted for Blackburn striker Adam Armstrong, who will have a medical with the Saints on Tuesday.

item.title: Romelu Lukaku: Chelsea close to sealing club-record £97.5m deal for Inter Milan striker
item.description: Chelsea are close to sealing a deal to re-sign striker Romelu Lukaku for a club-record fee of £97.5m from Inter Milan.

item.title: George Burgess returns to Australia joining NRL side St George Illawarra Dragons
item.description: George Burgess returns to Australia, signing a two-and-a-half-year deal with NRL side St George Illawarra Dragons.
